channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Federal cuts to National Institutes of Health could threaten medical progress
item.description: Former National Institutes of Health Director Dr. Francis Collins, who abruptly left his NIH research lab in February, fears aggressive downsizing cou...

item.title: How Armenia is trying to build a Silicon Valley in the Caucasus
item.description: The country is aiming to boost its technology sector by training children in tech from a young age.

item.title: Recently surfaced 9/11 evidence includes video of Capitol, airplane sketch | 60 Minutes
item.description: Important questions are being raised about 9/11 as evidence surfaces in a lawsuit against the Saudi government filed by families of the people killed ...

item.title: Suspect named after car ramming in Vancouver kills 11
item.description: Kai-Ji Adam Lo, a 30-year-old resident of the city, is charged with several counts of second degree murder.

item.title: Trump 'thinks' Zelensky ready to give up Crimea to Russia
item.description: The latest comments by the US president come despite Kyiv repeatedly rejecting ceding the peninsula.

item.title: 4/23: CBS Evening News Plus
item.description: Breaking down the Trump administration's mixed messages on China tariffs; Families of El Paso shooting victims ask to hug gunman in court

item.title: 4/27: CBS Weekend News
item.description: At least 11 killed in car attack at Vancouver Filipino street festival; A daring Pan Am evacuation before the fall of Saigon

item.title: The Puzzling Death of Susann Sills

item.title: Cardinal Vincent Nichols expects a 'mood of reflection' at his first conclave
item.description: As he prepares to enter the seclusion of a conclave to elect a new pope, Cardinal Vincent Nichols, the Archbishop of Westminster, reflects on diversit...

item.title: Homes destroyed and 1,500 detained in Kashmir as India cracks down following attacks
item.description: Indian authorities have detained at least 1,500 people in India-administered Kashmir after a militant attack killed 26 people this past week, a top po...

item.title: Ukrainian families divided by Russian occupation hang on and hope to be reunited
item.description: Ukrainians displaced by Russian occupation are helping the war effort — and longing for the homes they fled and the loved ones they left behind.

item.title: The DEA says 114 immigrants in the U.S. illegally were arrested at a Colorado nightclub
item.description: The Drug Enforcement Administration said the arrests occurred as part of a raid at an underground nightclub in Colorado Springs.

item.title: 'Prophetic' letter written by Titanic survivor sells for nearly $400,000 at auction

item.title: South Africa will defend sovereignty, ANC chair says as tensions with US grow
item.description: The ANC chair's comments come after months of US tension over race relations and land law.

item.title: Trump says Columbus Day will now just be Columbus Day
item.description: Trump will not follow Biden’s practice of recognizing Indigenous Peoples Day alongside Columbus Day in October.

item.title: As Musk gained power in Washington, his popularity has fallen, an AP-NORC poll finds

item.description: The Philippines, which disputes China's claim to the sandbank, responds by releasing a photo of its own forces on another.

item.title: Suspect arrested in Homeland Security Secretary Noem’s purse theft
